dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4646 IH: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1900 Corporate Drive in Birmingham, Alabama, as the “Lance Corporal Thomas E. Rivers, Jr. Post Office Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Palmer (for himself, Mr. Byrne, Mrs. Roby, Mr. Rogers of Alabama, Mr. Brooks of Alabama, Mr. Aderholt, and Ms. Sewell of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1900 Corporate Drive in Birmingham, Alabama, as the Lance Corporal Thomas E. Rivers, Jr. Post Office Building.

section.header: Lance Corporal Thomas E. Rivers, Jr. Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1900 Corporate Drive in Birmingham, Alabama, shall be known and designated as the Lance Corporal Thomas E. Rivers, Jr. Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Lance Corporal Thomas E. Rivers, Jr. Post Office Building.
